# GitHub Copilot Instructions

This file provides guidelines and instructions for using GitHub Copilot in this repository.

## Purpose
- Assist contributors with code suggestions and reviews.
- Automate repetitive coding tasks.
- Improve code quality and consistency.

## Usage
- Use Copilot to generate code snippets, documentation, and tests.
- Review Copilot suggestions before committing.
- Ensure generated code follows project conventions and standards.

## Best Practices
- Always validate Copilot-generated code for correctness and security.
- Edit and refine suggestions to match the project's style.
- Do not commit sensitive information generated by Copilot.

## Contribution
- All contributors are encouraged to use Copilot for productivity.
- Report issues or improvements related to Copilot usage in the repository.

## Security

- Validate input sanitization practices.
- Search for risks that might expose user data.
- Prefer loading configuration and content from the database instead of hard coded content. If absolutely necessary, load it from environment variables or a non-committed config file.

## Code Quality

- Use consistent naming conventions.
- Try to reduce code duplication.
- Prefer maintainability and readability over optimization.
- If a method is used a lot, try to optimize it for performance.
- Prefer explicit error handling over silent failures.
---
For more information, visit the [GitHub Copilot documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot).
